content: OK, I have a public build at https://fhir-build.visualstudio.com/build.fhir.org/_build/index?context=mine&path=%5C&definitionId=3&_a=history -- probably some new bugs introduced, but notifications will come here and we can continue to evaluate.

Thanks to @Michael Hansen for advice + support in getting this running. And for anyone interested, the VM setup is documented at https://github.com/hl7-fhir/auto-ig-builder/tree/master/vsts-build/fhir-vm-template.
so are we ready to transit to this one?
Let me re-enable the publication push to build.fhir.org. If that's working well, we can cut over tomorrow.

BTW Grahame, are there currently disabled validations that we should try enabling in the VSTS build? (We could always do two builds, e.g., with the more stringent one as an FYI, or even as a gate on publication, while also getting a "fast result" back to this Zulip channel.)
how much do people value the fast response?

Fast response that's not complete isn't very valuable. If I'm staying up to make sure the build is successful but subsequently it's deemed broken, that doesn't help much. We need to presume that anything not caught by the fast response will be ignored. If we don't want stuff ignored, then just have one response.
I'd agree with that, but I do like the fast response :)
so.. no change for now... I'll add the validation back into the build
isn't adding the validation back into the build a change?
